channel.title: [317] Skill cape for Bluurr based client. [HELP]
channel.description:
So basically what the deal is I have been following [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,437291.msg3213343.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,437291.msg3213343.html[/url] tut, but After doing everything (including swat new animation method + extended animations) when I try to do a skill cape emote this is what happens. [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/14ais61.png[/img] I have looked through the forums for a good 5 hours now.... raping the search button in the process...
Btw, I'm using a bluurr based client and Delta-based source.
I would be THANKFUL for any sort of help :P

item.title: [317] Skill cape for Bluurr based client. [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

Sorry, was tired, anyway, after you add the animations into class20, you need to do the emote, try something like:

if(command.equals("skillcape")){ String args[] = command.split("-"); if(args.length == 3){ pAnim(Integer.parseInt(args[1]); pGfx(Integer.parseInt(args[2])); } else { sendMessage("Invalid syntax, use as ::skillcape-emote-gfx"); } }

I use pGfx for GFX, and pAnim for Animations, change them to whatever yours are, and type ::skillcape-emote id-gfx id

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Skill cape for Bluurr based client. [HELP]

item.title: [317] Skill cape for Bluurr based client. [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @uri316 uri316
item.description:
@uri316 wrote:

ahem

[quote=“uri316, post:1, topic:364001”]After doing everything (including swat new animation method + extended animations) when I try to do a skill cape emote this is what happens.

14ais61.png758×495
[/quote]

Also I didn’t need to do model pre-loading :
Followed this tut http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,451405.msg3309028.html#msg3309028 to fix the problem with facing the wrong direction.
Anyways right now the problem is that whenever I try to do the emote, the GFX happens but my player just stands there doing nothing. Suggestions?

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Skill cape for Bluurr based client. [HELP]

item.title: [317] Skill cape for Bluurr based client. [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

If you’re preloading the models, as long as they’re in the folder, you’re safe there.

You need have this tuts: Swat new emote system & Extending emote list

^ Use the search button to find both of them, and make sure they’re added to your source correctly.

Read full topic
